update.description:
Currently multiplying `Pose3` objects does not match the behavior of multiplying `Matrix4` coordinate transformation matrices. This is illustrated in 7f7ed51, where `matrix1 * matrix2 * matrix3 == pose3 * pose2 * pose1`. This has been discussed in #60 and previously in [gazebo issue 216](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/216/pose-addition-and-subtraction-needs-work). The `*` operator is not used often, so we should just change it to be correct.

I noticed this issue most recently while working on an sdformat pull request related to pose transformations.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/commits

~~I've targeted `ign-math4`, but we should discuss where this change should be made and released.~~

EDIT: I've re-targeted to `ign-math5`
update.title: Change definition of Pose3 `*` operator to fix multiplication order (#60)
